summary:
A state is like a boss that rules over an area, making sure everyone follows the rules. It's like a country's parent! Governments are how states control things. Most countries have one state, but some have smaller parts called provinces or regions, which also have some power.

Long ago, people lived without states, but then cities grew, and governments formed. Now, there are different types of states, like the modern nation-state, which is what we usually think of when we hear the word "country." Some famous thinkers, like Max Weber, say a state is the only one allowed to use force.
title: State (polity)
